main.name: Stephen Hendrix
main.description: Full-Stack Developer with a passion for problem-solving and collaboration
main.bio: After completing SMU's coding boot camp, I was immediately asked to come back as a Teaching Assistant because of my passion for problem-solving and ability to learn new technologies quickly. Teaching others gave me a chance to sharpen my own understanding - in order to communicate effectively, I had to make sure that my own ideas were clear (something that I learned quickly during my time as a classroom teacher). I'm currently employed as a full-stack developer, and have taken on some contract work during my journey. I've been fortunate enough to work on a variety of projects involving a variety of technology; the desire to learn is my primary motivation, especially when I get to do it alongside a great team.
main.contactmessage: I hope you'll get in touch to let me know about any exciting or interesting opportunities (as soon as this button is working!).

resume.skillmessage: I've been involved in education because of my love of learning; it's prepared me well to work with a team and to stay curious about new technology.

education.description: Earned an A+ in a rigorous curriculum that covers a full stack: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, Node.js, Java, Express.js, React.js, Database Theory, MongoDB, MySQL, Command Line, Git, and more. Gained experience working in group projects with personal contributions in each of these technologies.

education.degree: B.A. History of Western Mathematics and Science; Philosophy. Minors in Comparative Literature and Linguistics
education.description: A Great Books school where classes are small and lessons are student-led discussions. Whether translating Aristotle or proving Einstein's most famous equations, we learned by reading primary sources and working together to build a deep understanding of fundamental ideas.

work.title: Full-Stack Developer
work.description: At Event Dynamic I'm part of an impressive team that collaborates closely. I've become accustomed to working on assigned tasks in Jira, while communicating with others to reduce redundancy and optimize performance. I've helped with aspects of the front and back ends, from making reusable components and configuring redux stores to creating endpoints in Java.

work.title: Lead Full-Stack Developer
work.description: As the tech lead, I have a hand in every aspect of development, from the front and back ends to hosting and security. Our current and main project makes use of the MERN stack and is hosted through Heroku. I work closely with the supervisor and partners to ensure that our design and functionality remains impeccable, which I think of as a reflection of the code itself.

work.title: Full-Stack Web Development Teaching Assistant
work.description: Teach students concept in coding, including Git, GitHub, HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, JQuery, Bootstrap, Firebase, Heroku, Node Js, MySQL, MongoDB, Express, Handelbars.js, ReactJS, and object-oriented programming. Encourage and model best practices and a problem-solving mindset.

projects.title: Marvel Personalities
projects.category: A way to generate your favorite Marvel superhero personality Big 5 personality profiles. Powered by IBM Watson and Marvel APIs

projects.title: Quirk
projects.category: A project management tool that allows users to assign boards and tasks to one another. Full-stack application with user authentication.

projects.title: Neighborly
projects.category: A way for volunteers and those in need of volunteers to connect quickly.

testimonials.text: The Dallas Area Rape Crisis Center website does not currently have any developers or web support on staff. Stephen donated his time and expertise to us to help fix a few bugs we were experiencing in the site recently. His knowledge of development leads him to quickly solve any issues. Stephen kindly did this work for us onsite so that we could be a part of the process. He taught us some tips and tricks to help solve future issues. Working with him was a great experience and we truly appreciate his skill and patience. Thanks Stephen!
testimonials.user: Janelle Gettmann, Dallas Rape Crisis Center
